notes.title: Welcome to Your Notes App
notes.content:
Welcome to Your Personal Notes App!

This is a rich text editor where you can:

  • Write and format your notes
  • Use italic and bold text
  • Create lists and organize content
  • Add tags for better organization

Start creating your first note by clicking the "Create Note" button!
notes.plainTextContent: Welcome to Your Personal Notes App! This is a rich text editor where you can write and format your notes, use italic and bold text, create lists and organize content, add tags for better organization. Start creating your first note by clicking the "Create Note" button!

notes.title: Recipe - Chocolate Chip Cookies
notes.content:
üç™ Chocolate Chip Cookies Recipe

Ingredients:

  • 2¬º cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 cup butter, softened
  • ¬æ cup granulated sugar
  • ¬æ cup brown sugar
  • 2 large eggs
  • 2 tsp vanilla extract
  • 2 cups chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C)
  2. Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl
  3. Beat butter and sugars until creamy
  4. Add eggs and vanilla, beat well
  5. Gradually beat in flour mixture
  6. Stir in chocolate chips
  7. Drop rounded tablespoons onto ungreased cookie sheets
  8. Bake 9-11 minutes until golden brown
notes.plainTextContent: Chocolate Chip Cookies Recipe. Ingredients: 2¬º cups all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp salt, 1 cup butter softened, ¬æ cup granulated sugar, ¬æ cup brown sugar, 2 large eggs, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 2 cups chocolate chips. Instructions: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F, Mix dry ingredients, Beat butter and sugars, Add eggs and vanilla, Gradually add flour, Stir in chocolate chips, Drop onto cookie sheets, Bake 9-11 minutes.

notes.title: Book Notes - Atomic Habits
notes.content:
üìñ Atomic Habits - Book Notes

Key Concepts:

  • Habit Loop: Cue ‚Üí Craving ‚Üí Response ‚Üí Reward
  • Identity-Based Habits: Focus on who you want to become
  • Environment Design: Make good habits obvious and easy
  • Habit Stacking: Attach new habits to existing ones

Important Quotes:

"You do not rise to the level of your goals. You fall to the level of your systems."
"Every action you take is a vote for the type of person you wish to become."

Practical Applications:

  • Start with 1% improvements
  • Focus on systems, not goals
  • Make habits attractive and satisfying
  • Track your progress
notes.plainTextContent: Atomic Habits - Book Notes. Key Concepts: Habit Loop Cue Craving Response Reward, Identity-Based Habits focus on who you want to become, Environment Design make good habits obvious and easy, Habit Stacking attach new habits to existing ones. Important Quotes: You do not rise to the level of your goals. You fall to the level of your systems. Every action you take is a vote for the type of person you wish to become.

notes.title: Quick Reference - CSS Flexbox
notes.content:
üé® CSS Flexbox Quick Reference

Container Properties:

  • display: flex - Creates flex container
  • flex-direction: row | column - Main axis direction
  • justify-content: center | space-between | space-around - Main axis alignment
  • align-items: center | stretch | flex-start - Cross axis alignment
  • flex-wrap: wrap | nowrap - Wrapping behavior

Item Properties:

  • flex: 1 - Grow to fill available space
  • flex-grow: 1 - Ability to grow
  • flex-shrink: 0 - Ability to shrink
  • flex-basis: 200px - Initial size
  • align-self: center - Override container alignment
notes.plainTextContent: CSS Flexbox Quick Reference. Container Properties: display flex creates flex container, flex-direction row column main axis direction, justify-content center space-between space-around main axis alignment, align-items center stretch flex-start cross axis alignment, flex-wrap wrap nowrap wrapping behavior. Item Properties: flex 1 grow to fill available space, flex-grow 1 ability to grow, flex-shrink 0 ability to shrink, flex-basis 200px initial size, align-self center override container alignment.

notes.title: Daily Journal - January 20
notes.content:
üìù Daily Journal - January 20, 2024

Morning:

Started the day with a 30-minute meditation session. Feeling refreshed and focused. Had a healthy breakfast with oatmeal and berries.

Work:

Completed the user authentication module. Had a productive standup meeting with the team. Made good progress on the API integration.

Afternoon:

Attended a webinar about React performance optimization. Learned some new techniques for code splitting and lazy loading.

Evening:

Cooked dinner with friends. We made pasta with homemade sauce. Watched a movie and relaxed.

Gratitude:

  • Good health and energy
  • Supportive team at work
  • Quality time with friends

Had a healthy breakfast with oatmeal and berries. Work: Completed the user authentication module. Had a productive standup meeting with the team. Made good progress on the API integration.

notes.title: üîí Personal Diary Entry
notes.content:
Personal Thoughts - January 19, 2024

Today was a challenging day. I felt overwhelmed with work and personal responsibilities. Sometimes it's hard to find balance.

I'm grateful for the small moments of joy - a good cup of coffee, a text from a friend, watching the sunset from my window.

Tomorrow is a new day, and I'm determined to approach it with a positive mindset.

I'm grateful for the small moments of joy - a good cup of coffee, a text from a friend, watching the sunset from my window.

notes.title: Code Snippets - JavaScript
notes.content:
üíª Useful JavaScript Code Snippets

Array Methods:

// Filter unique values
const unique = [...new Set(array)];

// Find object in array
const user = users.find(u => u.id === userId);

// Group by property
const grouped = array.reduce((acc, item) => {
  const key = item.category;
  acc[key] = acc[key] || [];
  acc[key].push(item);
  return acc;
}, {});

Async/Await:

// Fetch with error handling
async function fetchData(url) {
  try {
    const response = await fetch(url);
    const data = await response.json();
    return data;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error:', error);
    throw error;
  }
}
notes.plainTextContent: Useful JavaScript Code Snippets. Array Methods: Filter unique values, Find object in array, Group by property. Async/Await: Fetch with error handling. Code examples for common JavaScript operations and patterns.
